message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with improving the accuracy of Optical Character Recognition (OCR) through statistical learning, which involves using external corpus and OCR-specific features in a regression approach to correct OCR-generated errors. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, which fall under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper deals with image processing (cs.CV) as OCR involves recognizing text from images. The use of statistical learning also falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper involves information retrieval (cs.IR) as it deals with correcting errors in text, which is a common task in information retrieval systems.
